Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Each case has a sequence of activities from when a ticket is received up until it's closed.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I'll need to calculate the total resolution time for each case. That means adding up all the time intervals between the first receipt and the last close.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Looking at the data, I notice that some cases start with a late receipt time. For example, Case 101 was received on March 1, 2024, 8:00 AM, but Case 104 was received at 8:20 AM. This inconsistency might be a factor.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If a ticket is received too late, it could delay the entire resolution process.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: I should check for escalations. Some cases escalate tickets to higher levels, like going from Level-1 to Level-2. These escalations can introduce delays because tickets have to go through additional steps, which takes time.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Long waiting times between activities could also be a problem. For instance, after a ticket is Triage, it might take several activities to escalate to the final resolution.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Case 101, the total time is from 8:00 AM to 10:15 AM, which is about 2 hours and 15 minutes. In contrast, Case 104 is resolved much quicker, taking only 7:30 hours total. Looking at Case 105, it escalates once and then closes. The total time here is longer than Cases 101 and 104.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Escalations might be causing the delay because they require additional steps that take time to process.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: To determine which factors are causing the bottlenecks, I should analyze the total resolution times. Cases with longer times are those that escalated more, had longer wait times, or were received later.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I should also check if there are any recurring escalations or if the ticket management system is inefficient, leading to more escalations than necessary. Maybe the system is not prioritizing tickets that require more complex steps.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - NE
Text: In terms of recommendations, improving ticket receipt timing could help reduce delays. Maybe enhancing the ticketing system to notify users more promptly could mitigate this.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Additionally, reducing escalations by optimizing the ticket management process would help. Perhaps automating escalations or consolidating tickets could streamline the process and cut down on unnecessary delays.
